member.summary: Collection of all s supported by Invoicing

summary.p: The STANDARD mode provides the latest recommended default values that should be safe to run in most scenarios
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The IN_REGION mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for applications which call AWS services from within the same AWS region
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The CROSS_REGION mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for applications which call AWS services in a different region
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The MOBILE mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for mobile applications
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The AUTO mode is an experimental mode that builds on the standard mode. The SDK will attempt to discover the execution environment to determine the appropriate settings automatically.

Note that the auto detection is heuristics-based and does not guarantee 100% accuracy. STANDARD mode will be used if the execution environment cannot be determined. The auto detection might query EC2 Instance Metadata service, which might introduce latency. Therefore we recommend choosing an explicit defaults_mode instead if startup latency is critical to your application
The LEGACY mode provides default settings that vary per SDK and were used prior to establishment of defaults_mode

member.name: T:Amazon.Invoicing.Internal.AmazonInvoicingEndpointResolver
member.summary: Amazon Invoicing endpoint resolver. Custom PipelineHandler responsible for resolving endpoint and setting authentication parameters for Invoicing service requests. Collects values for InvoicingEndpointParameters and then tries to resolve endpoint by calling ResolveEndpoint method on GlobalEndpoints.Provider if present, otherwise uses InvoicingEndpointProvider. Responsible for setting authentication and http headers provided by resolved endpoint.

member.name: T:Amazon.Invoicing.Model.Filters
member.summary: An optional input to the list API. If multiple filters are specified, the returned list will be a configuration that match all of the provided filters. Supported filter types are InvoiceReceivers, Names, and Accounts.

member.name: P:Amazon.Invoicing.Model.Filters.Accounts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Accounts.
You can specify a list of Amazon Web Services account IDs inside filters to return invoice units that match only the specified accounts. If multiple accounts are provided, the result is an OR condition (match any) of the specified accounts. The specified account IDs are matched with either the receiver or the linked accounts in the rules.

member.name: P:Amazon.Invoicing.Model.Filters.InvoiceReceivers
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InvoiceReceivers.
You can specify a list of Amazon Web Services account IDs inside filters to return invoice units that match only the specified accounts. If multiple accounts are provided, the result is an OR condition (match any) of the specified accounts. This filter only matches the specified accounts on the invoice receivers of the invoice units.

member.name: P:Amazon.Invoicing.Model.Filters.Names
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Names.
An optional input to the list API. You can specify a list of invoice unit names inside filters to return invoice units that match only the specified invoice unit names. If multiple names are provided, the result is an OR condition (match any) of the specified invoice unit names.

Your Tax Registration Number (TRN) information.

member.name: T:Amazon.Invoicing.Model.InvoiceUnit
member.summary: An invoice unit is a set of mutually exclusive accounts that correspond to your business entity. Invoice units allow you separate Amazon Web Services account costs and configures your invoice for each business entity going forward.

member.name: P:Amazon.Invoicing.Model.InvoiceUnit.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
The assigned description for an invoice unit. This information can't be modified or deleted.

member.name: P:Amazon.Invoicing.Model.InvoiceUnit.InvoiceReceiver
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InvoiceReceiver.
The account that receives invoices related to the invoice unit.

member.name: P:Amazon.Invoicing.Model.InvoiceUnit.InvoiceUnitArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InvoiceUnitArn.
ARN to identify an invoice unit. This information can't be modified or deleted.

member.name: P:Amazon.Invoicing.Model.InvoiceUnit.LastModified
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastModified.
The last time the invoice unit was updated. This is important to determine the version of invoice unit configuration used to create the invoices. Any invoice created after this modified time will use this invoice unit configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.Invoicing.Model.InvoiceUnit.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
A unique name that is distinctive within your Amazon Web Services.

member.name: P:Amazon.Invoicing.Model.InvoiceUnit.Rule
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Rule.
An InvoiceUnitRule object used the categorize invoice units.

member.name: P:Amazon.Invoicing.Model.InvoiceUnit.TaxInheritanceDisabled
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TaxInheritanceDisabled.
Whether the invoice unit based tax inheritance is/ should be enabled or disabled.

member.name: T:Amazon.Invoicing.Model.InvoiceUnitRule
member.summary: This is used to categorize the invoice unit. Values are Amazon Web Services account IDs. Currently, the only supported rule is LINKED_ACCOUNT.

member.name: P:Amazon.Invoicing.Model.InvoiceUnitRule.LinkedAccounts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LinkedAccounts.
The list of LINKED_ACCOUNT IDs where charges are included within the invoice unit.

member.name: T:Amazon.Invoicing.Model.ListInvoiceUnitsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ListInvoiceUnits operation. This fetches a list of all invoice unit definitions for a given account, as of the provided AsOf date.

member.name: P:Amazon.Invoicing.Model.ListInvoiceUnitsRequest.AsOf
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AsOf.
The state of an invoice unit at a specified time. You can see legacy invoice units that are currently deleted if the AsOf time is set to before it was deleted. If an AsOf is not provided, the default value is the current time.

member.name: P:Amazon.Invoicing.Model.ListInvoiceUnitsRequest.Filters
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Filters.
An optional input to the list API. If multiple filters are specified, the returned list will be a configuration that match all of the provided filters. Supported filter types are InvoiceReceivers, Names, and Accounts.

member.summary:

The maximum number of invoice units that can be returned.

member.summary:

The next token used to indicate where the returned list should start from.

summary.para: You can use Amazon Web Services Invoice Configuration APIs to programmatically create, update, delete, get, and list invoice units. You can also programmatically fetch the information of the invoice receiver. For example, business legal name, address, and invoicing contacts.

You can use Amazon Web Services Invoice Configuration to receive separate Amazon Web Services invoices based your organizational needs. By using Amazon Web Services Invoice Configuration, you can configure invoice units that are groups of Amazon Web Services accounts that represent your business entities, and receive separate invoices for each business entity. You can also assign a unique member or payer account as the invoice receiver for each invoice unit. As you create new accounts within your Organizations using Amazon Web Services Invoice Configuration APIs, you can automate the creation of new invoice units and subsequently automate the addition of new accounts to your invoice units.
You can use the following endpoints for Amazon Web Services Invoice Configuration:

member.name: M:Amazon.Invoicing.AmazonInvoicingClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonInvoicingClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>
